text: this is Marcus Mabry for the New York
Times using social media sources here's
what we've learned about the suspects of
the Boston Marathon bombing a blog post
by purported classmate of Johanna F now
19 shows a picture of him from two years
ago with his friends and his high school
prom other sites show he won a high
school scholarship competition and has
enrolled at the University of
Massachusetts at Dartmouth Johar has a
profile on Russia's equivalent of
Facebook he speaks English
Russian and Chechen he says his
worldview is Islam and he lists Chechen
affinity groups on April 9th he posted a
violent video about the civil war in
Syria on a Twitter account believed to
be his there are several posted photos
including this one at a pool he worked
as a lifeguard at Harvard University
there are also several tweets after the
bombing on Monday including one that
reads I'm a stress free kind of guy it
is unclear if his older brother 26 year
old Tamerlan who was killed in a
confrontation with police on Friday was
as active online a website called
PhotoShelter
shows him as an accomplished boxer the
photographer johannes Hearn quoted
Tamerlan as saying he was very religious
on a YouTube channel that bares
tamerlan's name there's a playlist
titled terrorist those videos are no
longer available there's another
playlist entitled Islam it includes
images of militants training
you
